abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) and
            Kredit UJmum Pedesan (KUPEDES) Small Credit Project in
            Indonesia. The Project's objectives were: (a) to
            promote BRI's ongoing efforts to strengthen and expand
            its Unit Desa system as a financially viable sub branch
            network that mobilizes resources and provides nonsubsidized
            credit nationwide to creditworthy small borrowers; and (b)
            to continue support to develop BRI's institutional
            capability as related to its Unit Desa system. Bank
            performance in the various stages of the Project cycle was
            satisfactory. Borrower’s performance was satisfactory. The
            key lessons learned were as follows: (i) a necessary
            condition for the success of credit and savings programs is
            sound macroeconomic performance of the economy and an
            overall good record of growth; (ii) objectives should be
            thoroughly discussed by the Bank with, and understood and
            agreed by the Borrower; (iii) the success of the Project
            owes much to its simple design; (iv) assured access to
            lending, convenience of location and prompt credit decisions
            are more important to small borrowers than getting a lower
            interest rate; (v) safety, accessibility convenience of
            service location, and acceptable interest rate provided are
            the needs of the potential depositors to be satisfied; (vi)
            provided that the needs of the potential depositors are
            satisfied and (vii) any extra reporting requirement solely
            for Bank purposes should be minimized so that the
            implementation agency can focus more on project implementation
